alert.note: Alert for Kent (Michigan) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Watch issued January 26 at 11:18AM EST until further notice by NWS Grand Rapids
info.description: ...The National Weather Service in Grand Rapids MI has issued a Flood Watch for the following rivers in Michigan... Grand River near Comstock Park affecting Kent County. .Around a half inch of rain has fallen on a deep snowpack leading to runoff and melting. Heavier rainfall upstream and snow melt will add to the already rising water levels. The river may rise to minor flood stage by early next week. ...FLOOD WATCH IN EFFECT FROM SUNDAY EVENING UNTIL FURTHER NOTICE... * WHAT...Flooding is possible. * WHERE...Grand River near Comstock Park. * WHEN...From Sunday evening until further notice. * IMPACTS...At 12.0 feet, Expect minor flooding of homes along Abrigador Trail. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 8:54 AM EST Friday the stage was 10.0 feet. - Forecast...Flood stage may be reached Sunday evening. - Flood stage is 12.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: If you are in the watch area, remain alert to possible flooding. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov/grr. The next statement will be issued by Saturday afternoon at 130 PM EST.
